result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) and PAC Cause Injury (2+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jacob J Lepak was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay Blood Draw Fee
*Pay costs
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

timeConds.notes:
*Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department 
*1/2 of jail sentence to be served on electronic home monitor
*Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
*Must report today for start date.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob J Lepak in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF272, 15FO341 and 15TR1661.

8:49 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF272:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - Dismissed

15FO341:
Count 1 - No contest 

15TR1661:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CF272 and Count 2 is dismissed; guilty of Count 1 in 15FO341 and Count 1 in 15TR1661 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Victim notification has been complied with as per the State.
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.
Victim makes a statement prior to the sentencing of the defendant.

BY THE COURT:
15CF272:
Count 1 -
Sentence Withheld
Placed on Probation for 24 months
**Conditions of Probation:
Conditional Jail of 60 days with huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department 
1/2 of jail sentence to be served on electronic home monitor
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
Pay fine of $1,200 plus costs 
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
24 month DL Revocation
24 month IID on any vehicles titled in his name 
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Count 2 -
Dismissed

15FO341:
Count 1 -
Pay fine of $263.50
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan

15TR1661:
Count 1 - DRI

Defendant Jacob J Lepak in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
**Cash bond previously posted.**   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Defendant Jacob J Lepak in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-272, 15FO-341 and 15TR-1661.

9:12 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Atty Kryshak has received a copy of the complaint, waives reading.

15FO-341 and 15TR-1661 - not guilty pleas are entered and to track with 15CF-272.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
